title: Alma Mahler
summary: Alma Maria Mahler Gropius Werfel (born Alma Margaretha Maria Schindler; 31 August 1879 â€“ 11 December 1964) was an Austrian composer, author, editor, and socialite. At 15, she was mentored by Max Burckhard. Musically active from her early years, she was the composer of nearly fifty songs for voice and piano, and works in other genres as well. Only 17 songs are known to survive.[1]
